name: Peanut Butter Popcorn Balls
author: Lilcat
summary: My mom made these every Halloween when I was a kid and you could still give this out as a treat. It still is a treat as a moist and chewy fall snack. You can make into balls or leave loose and serve like carmel corn if you prefer.
directions: Combine brown sugar, corn syrup, and butter in a large saucepan; cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a rolling boil
Remove saucepan from heat; stir in peanut butter until mixture is smooth
Place popcorn in a large bowl
Pour peanut butter mixture over popcorn; toss until evenly coated
Form into about 16 balls using buttered hands
Arrange balls on a waxed paper-lined baking sheet; allow to dry and set, at least 30 minutes
